With both players castled, the middle-game phase begins. Znosko-Borovsky, in his classic work "The Middle Game In Chess", declares that these kind of positions, where the opening is transitioning into the middle-game proper, are the most difficult to handle correctly even for grandmasters, let alone run-of-the-mill players.
